N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 17.4 - Approval of transfer without order

State Regulations
(a) The commissioner hereby approves
transfers without order from any facility in the department to any other
facility in the department for a period of 30 days for patients in need of
special medical or surgical care available in the receiving facility. Such
transfers shall be reported to the department as directed. (1)

Such transfers shall continue beyond 30
days between two facilities in different classes only with the approval of the
commissioner based on a request for extension showing: (i) The physical diagnosis or condition which
required the original transfer. (ii)
A summary of the treatment provided and
its effect. (iii)
A plan for
continued treatment to be provided and its goals. (iv)
A statement indicating why the required
treatment cannot be provided at the original facility. (v) A statement indicating how services for
the mentally disabled are being provided. (vi)

The additional period during which the
transfer without order is to be continued. (2)

Transfer for special medical or surgical
care between facilities of the same class may be extended beyond 30 days by
effectuating a transfer pursuant to sections 17.1 through
17.3
of this Part. (b) Unless otherwise prohibited by
court order in specific cases the commissioner hereby approves temporary
transfers without order from any facility in the department to the Institute
for Basic Research in Mental Retardation, for a period not to exceed 60 days, of patients or residents on voluntary, informal or non-objecting status. Written consent must be obtained from the patient or someone authorized to act
on his behalf. The transfer may be extended for an additional period of not to
exceed 60 days by order of the commissioner. No further extension is permitted. The patient or resident shall be returned to the facility from which he came
upon the expiration of the authorized transfer period but the patient or
resident shall be so returned prior to such expiration upon the request of the
patient or of the person who has given consent on behalf of the patient or upon
the determination of the director of said institute that his presence at the
institute is no longer needed. (c) The commissioner hereby approves temporary transfers without order of patients
who are required to appear at court hearings, to any other department facility
in proximity to the court where such court hearings are scheduled to be heard. Such transfers shall be reported to the department in accordance with
procedures set forth in the department's policy manual. Such temporary
transfers shall continue beyond 30 days only upon written approval of the
commissioner based upon a written request stating the reasons for the extended
period of transfer. (d) The Mental

Health Information Service shall be notified by the sending facility of any
such transfer without order. Notes
